headline: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
description: Learn how to make a grilled cheese sandwich in a nonstick pan with buttered bread and sliced Cheddar; serve with tomato soup for a comforting classic.

video.description: Just add cheese and toast till it's golden brown.
video.name: Grilled Cheese Sandwich

name: Grilled Cheese Sandwich

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Generously butter one side of a slice of bread. Place bread butter-side down in the hot skillet; add 1 slice of cheese. Butter a second slice of bread on one side and place butter-side up on top of cheese.
Cook until lightly browned on one side; flip over and continue cooking until cheese is melted. Repeat with remaining 2 slices of bread, butter, and slice of cheese.

review.reviewBody: Mixing cheeses together makes it even better. Cabot " Seriously Sharp " cheese along with cheddar or American, Swiss along with mild cheddar are great options. Sometimes I add a slice of ham, or some sliced tomatoes before I start grilling. Such a great sandwich with far too many options for changing it up!

Today has been a very nostalgic and melancholy day for me. My beloved Grandmother passed away 46 years ago today, January 30, 1977. When we were kids and Granny babysat us for the day since our parents were working .. our favorite lunch she fixed for us, especially on Fridays, was cream of tomato soup and grilled cheese sandwiches. I used this very simple and perfect recipe and fixed it for myself today amidst the tears. Thank you for helping me to remember Granny. Peace and all good.

It's a simple classic recipe. I use hamburger buns. I butter on both sides, place in skillet, brown on both sides, place a slice of cheddar cheese one slice of each bun. I then place the buttered buns on a plate and spread mayo and a slice of tomato. Then place the melted cheese bun atop each. Eat alone or with anything you like such as soup or chips. I like sweet pickles to the side.
Made this for dinner for me and my kids tonight!!! Delicious and very easy!!
ok meal i guess
I love this recipe. It's so easy to make and is so delicious. I used Parkay Spray butter instead of butter so that it would be less fattening.
fantastic sanwich
very hard and Chessy

This is my favorite way to do a grilled cheese sandwich. You can pick sharp or mild cheese according to taste. Personally, I prefer sharp cheddar. It's easy to make and you don't need many ingredients.
So easy and delicious! My 8 year old made it!

I made this recipe it was delicious besides the couple flowers that I made but this recipe delicious this is my first ever grilled cheese and like the third time I used the oven so yeah this is a good recipe love it five stars
I didn’t know how to make a grilled cheese before this this recipe saved me thank you I am eternally grateful
loved it
I'm just wandering why if it's a grilled cheese, why is it done on a flat top. I can do the same thing on my pit with the grill marks. Hence ....Grill Cheese. Just wanted to know. Thank you
it was good to eat and thank you for making this food it help allot.
My first grilled cheese and it was delicious. I enjoyed the simplicity. Thank you for the recipe.
A classic.
I added disks of hot dog on top—really good!
Awesome!! Just like my childhood where me and my best friend would share a grilled cheese sandwich her mom made.
Quick and easy! I used sourdough bread and added Stoneground Horseradish Mustard on the inside of the bread slices. Very tasty!
I had some shaved turkey breast and added it, just set the temp to high and add sandwiches and then turn it to medium to get it crispy , check regularly so it doesn’t burn.

Hello everyone! This recipe is my personal favourite. Preheat skillet over medium heat. Generously butter one side of a slice of bread. Place bread butter-side-down onto skillet bottom and add 1 slice of cheese. Butter a second slice of bread on one side and place butter-side-up on top of sandwich. Grill until lightly browned and flip over; continue grilling until cheese is melted. Repeat with remaining 2 slices of bread, butter and slice of cheese.

Loved this recipe. I did make a few minor tweaks. I used a kaiser roll, didn't grill it, put in the cheese as directed, added a couple of slices of deli ham, some mustard, some lettuce and viola! Dee-licious!
This was my first time making grilled cheese, and it was some of the best I have ever had in my life!
I was doing a project and had to pick a recipe and I could have done anything but I choose the easiest and my favorite food to pick.

I have to agree with some comments about this recipe. I know how to cook and bake. I'm 38, but, for someone who is just learning how to cook. These simple directions can really help someone who feels like a "giant" cookbook is intimidating. It's the little things people forget about. And sometimes "common" sense is not that common. All Recipes is a wonderful site to go to.

Toasted bread. Cheese. Have I mentioned: cheese? We laugh at this recipe but think how far we had to come as human beings to figure out bread, cheese, and fire. The fact that almost all humans love a grilled cheese sandwich is a celebration of our ancestors' triumphs. We should *never* look down at that in my opinion. Here's to grilled cheese!
great! one tip though: once they're done cooking, butter both sides again and add salt

I have read a ton of reviews on this one and here is my take: I learned in a restaurant that if you use a larger pan and leave the sandwich open in the pan on low heat to fry...the cheese will be melted perfectly and the outsides will be perfectly golden. Just close and serve! I also use mayo on the outside and usually throw some bacon on with the cheese :)
Very easy to make and delicious
Love it . Such a comfort food .

Perfection :) I thought my little sister wouldn't like it, but she happened to like it so much. Thanks to the Kraft ad for making me want to eat grilled cheese. 

The worse thing I did was to cut them in half as soon as I took them out and then separate them :'] rip to my fingers heh.
best grilled cheese ever

I'm surprised more people don't toast both sides of the bread. My family generally makes grilled cheese sandwiches on a griddle, so you could theoretically make about four to eight at a time. We just put the butter straight on the griddle then put as many slices of bread on that can fit. As soon as the first slice is finished toasting, we butter and flip it to the other side, putting a slice of cheese on the toasted side and a slice of half toasted bread on top with the toasted side on the cheese. This ensures the cheese will melt, as it will be between two warm toasted sides. Once the bottom side of the sandwich finishes toasting butter and flip it to toast the top. Make sure to use plenty of butter throughout the process.

Next time I'm going to steal someone's idea of putting some garlic/oregano/basil in the butter to see how that turns out. Yum!

I, too, am giving the basic grilled cheese 5 stars. I use the brown and cover on low method to make mine. I think the results of this post just goes to show that the grilled cheese is one of the most versatile, delicious sandwiches on the planet. It’s not vegan, but it can be! And it is vegetarian, yet ardently desired by meat-eaters. It can be made countless ways, without deviating from its grilled cheeseness. There is no “best” way. In the case of a grilled cheese, it’s really “all good”! I’d say it leaves burgers in the dust!
it worked really well i tried it on my sister vest sandwich ever
It's a classic. Thanks to one of the comments, I now prepare grilled cheese two ways- classic and with mayo and mustard (so delicious!!).
So Yummy
Perfect. Simple and delicious.
Used 2 slices Swiss in each sammie. Deeeeeelish
No it came out awesome
It was better than the ones I have been making for my son for years

Looks okay but why are they calling this a grilled cheese sandwich? This is fried. When I was growing up the sandwiches were baked in the oven, closer to being grilled as it is indirect heat. Does anyone actually grill a cheese sandwich?
My daughter liked it.
My daughter liked it.
tasty!!

There are infinite ways of making a grilled cheese sandwich. In my mind, this is the only way to do it, including using white bread. For someone just starting out in life, this recipe, and the reviews, are so needed and appreciated. May I add that I've found a pan on a stove works better for grilled cheese than an electric skillet or griddle. The heat is more even. Oh, and don't squish the sandwiches with your spatula. It ruins the fluffy texture of the bread, which is perfect against the golden buttery crispness of the grilled outer layer.
SO GOOD LOVE!!!
It tasted great!
amazing, delicious and extra stringy with Gouda Cheese
This was good and also very easy and simple!
Amazing
I made it using a baguette.. Would make great appetizers when adding tomato slices, bell peppers of any color, turkey ham etc. I would also make them with different kinds of cheese.

I prefer to rub the stick of butter around on the warm pan and flip it a couple times first instead of spreading it on the bread. Less work and you use less butter ( aka fat ) with the same results. A little garlic is a nice addition

You cant go wrong with grilled cheese. I think sour dough bread and cheddar are the best but most combos are good! The old commentary on this “recipe” was my favorite part. I hope everyone knows by now that butter (real butter) is not fattening and that the only fattening part of a grilled cheese is the bread. Fat doesn’t make you fat sweeties, it’s the processed refined carbohydrates that do. But everyone loves a comfort food every now and then!!
First time I made it and my 9 year old son loved that I made it crispy
No changes were made and I make it all the time.
I loved it and I will make it again

I decided to make this classic grilled cheese because I’ve been feeling nostalgic this week. My two twin boys Cody and Brody just went off to college and their favorite meal growing up was a simple no nonsense grilled cheese. It’s scary knowing they’re off forging their own path, but the memories kept in a grilled cheese are keeping me from bawling my eyes out knowing i’ll be waking up without my boys in the home. Even though it hurts, this is a pain that hopefully every parent can experience, to see their children grow and flourish. I even made one with mayonnaise instead of butter. That was Brody’s favorite, but YUCK! I’ll stick to this classic myself. Good work!
I used Monterrey Jack cheese instead of the yellow one and husband still loved it, he added ketchup on it though.

Classic. Simple. Perfectly delicious. 
My son loved it.
Very simple to make. Good option for kids snack box.
I think that this was a very amazing dish that the whole family was able to enjoy without complaints. I will definetly be making this dish again very soon! Loved it very much!
I used wheat bread and added pickles. I really enjoyed it.
I mean... it's grilled cheese! Another option would be to use Sourdough bread and use Muenster cheese.
I made this and it was amazing it was creamy cheesy And crispy but also soft
I used different cheese swiss and pepperjack
try sprinkling parmesan cheese on the butter before frying. amazing.

You can't go wrong with grilled cheese, in fact I think I may make myself one for lunch. However, you left out the one ingredient that makes it taste so much better, Miracle Whip. Spread a little on the bread then put in the cheese - perfection!

I know there are a lot of rude comments but I appreciate this being uploaded. I have never liked grilled cheese and though I did vaguely know what to do it was nice to have the recipe now that I am pregnant and craving them lol I added a bit of mustard like someone else recommended and it is delish!
Yes. I added cooked bacon and used extra sharp cheddar cheese. GREAT!!!!
This is absolutely terrific... I did not have any bread so I substituted it for cereal , and nor did I have cheese so I used milk instead... Tastes wonderful, the butter was great touch!
Added some chopped onion and bacon.
I loved it! This was a very traditional and easy ten minute grilled cheese sandwich.
Real good
So delicious ! Quick and easy snack !
It was soooo delish!! :)
Simple and easy ro to follow. I dont know how to cook. So it wasnt hard for me.
Simple quick meal, great for beginners.
Made mine with sharp shredded cheddar cheese on rye. Very good and easy to make.

I made this, with just a few simple changes. I used pasta instead of bread because that's what I had on hand, and instead of the butter I used chicken broth because I'm trying to go low-fat. The cheese would have been great but I decide to 'upgrade' by using a mix of shredded chicken, celery, onions and carrots. 

To be honest, this tasted more like chicken noodle soup than anything else. 5 stars.
Great and easy, suggest grilling over low heat
1 slice of cheese doesn't cut it. Also, I tried mayonnaise instead of butter and my kids loved it.

Perfect 
Will make over and over!
I love the simplicity of a basic grilled cheese and eat them religiously! My husband's favorite version is a grilled cheese with a fried egg in the middle. Delish!!
It is easy to prepare! Great taste!

There really are people who don't know how to make grilled cheese (my husband), and this is the basic recipe. I don't use nearly this much butter--just lightly spread it on your bread. American cheese slices melt the best, but try whatever you like. I used Colby jack this time. Medium heat cooks them too quickly-- medium low gives the cheese enough time to melt without burning the bread.

I have I a couple of tips ...
1) try using a bit of mayo instead of butter. You get the same crisp without the oily.
And 
2) soft or whipped cream cheese instead of sliced cheese, you WON’T regret it!

To make a GREAT sandwich awesome, just sprinkle some Parmesan cheese on the buttered bread before putting into the skillet. WOW, what an upgrade in flavor. I got the idea from Marie Callendar's "Frisco burger", which they do using sour dough bread for their burgers.
Love the comments. Maybe it's just me but seriously....a recipe for a grilled cheese sandwich? Come on! If you can't make one, get out of the kitchen.

I think it is great that you included this recipe. Simple to most of us but some people new to our country, College kids, and men or boys can even do this one. If you have never tried a Toasted Cheese sandwich well it is very good and inexpensive and most people have the supplies on hand.
This made me lol because of the Super Bowl commercial with Gordan Ramsey yelling because you don't need a recipe for grilled cheese because the recipe is in the name.
Try using mayo instead of butter! It is SO much better. Also once you flip the sandwich place a saucer on top of it. It helps the cheese to melt.

Pair this with tomato soup and you have my all-time favorite school lunch. Oh to be a kid again!

PS..Note to REVBUD the only difference between yellow and white cheddar is the dye used to make it yellow.

Hey guys! Don't make fun of 'basic recipes'....I'm 75, have been making grilled cheese for at least 65 years, & still found some great ideas reading these reviews! Also, most 'young people' going off to college or on their own these days don't have a clue how to make tea, never mind food! My version was always exactly like this basic recipe, & I always dipped it in Ketchup! try it....it's great! and Tomato soup with it is nearly carved in stone! lol.
I do exactly what she does, however, I use American cheese which I prefer more than Cheddar.

My kids grew up on grilled cheese sandwiches & tomato soup but when they got older I changed the grilled cheese up with thin sliced turkey, gouda cheese (instead of cheddar) & Dijon, thin sliced London Broil with tomato and horseradish. 

As long as you have bread, butter and good stuff to put on the bread you'll have a great grilled sandwich!!!

I love grilled cheese sandwiches and I pretty much make mine like this recipe, but I also enjoyed reading how people do theirs a little different. Always good to try things. Thank you for posting and allowing others to tweak a little.

Never follow this recipe because it's fatally flawed. The butter should be placed on the cheese side. The heat from the grilling will melt the butter, infuse it throughout the bread, and result in a much tastier sandwich with minimal greasiness on the bread.
